title: Saudi Arabia Starts Natural Gas Production at Giant Jafurah Project
summary: Saudi Arabia has launched production at the giant Jafurah natural gas field, the largest non-associated gas development in the Kingdom, which is key to the Saudi goal to significantly boost its gas processing capacity to meet rising demand. title: Trump administration to announce new fuel economy standards Wednesday, sources say
summary: The oil industry group the American Petroleum Institute has lobbied the Trump administration to repeal the Biden fuel economy standards.

title: Soaring U.S. Natural Gas Prices Could Boost Coal Power Generation
summary: U.S. coal-fired power generation is set to rebound in the winter months as surging natural gas prices prompt utilities to switch from gas to using more coal. title: Trafigura says growth in China oil demand to hit multiyear low in 2026
summary: Commodity trader says growth in India will overtake that in China for first time

title: Pakistan Inks Five Oil and Gas Exploration Deals
summary: Pakistan has signed five deals for oil and gas exploration with local private and state-owned companies that will develop three offshore and two onshore blocks, Pakistani media reported, citing a securities filing. title: US Crude Oil Inventories Are Shrinking, Despite Calls For Glut
summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States saw a draw of 2.48 million barrels in the week ending November 28.
